Description: Liquid biopsy represents a transformation in the management of oncology patients given its potential to detect, characterize and monitor cancers earlier than can be achieved with conventional modalities. Due to its noninvasive nature, availability and accessibility, liquid biopsy offers an alternative sampling option when tissue is unavailable or insufficient. In this presentation, we demonstrate the following: 1) The utility of an NGS-based ctDNA testing approach for therapy selection in advanced cancers; 2) Tissue-agnostic treatment response monitoring in patients with metastatic colorectal cancer and its prognostic value in guiding treatment decisions.
